answers.answer: It could be a number of things, including low blood suger. Have you been tested for diabetes? If not, I would try and get tested as soon as possible. Good luck and I hope you get to feeling better.

A lack of proper blood supply to the head could be causing this problem.While you should ask the doctor if :A) ferritin and blood iron testing is in order to be sure you aren't iron deficient (deficiency with symptoms can happen even if it has not affected a complete blood count yet- happened to me with tiredness and increased shortness of breath and worse tachycardia than usual for me if I recall correctly)B) brain MRI or CT scan, given your headaches and light headed feelings, would be in order andC) if you have a history or have high bad cholesterol and or high triglycerides, if a doppler of your carotid arteries in your neck would be in order to make sure there is not a blockage:it might have to do with intolerance with being in an upright position or standing.  See a forum where many of us with orthostatic intolerance from a dysfunction with our autonomic nervous system post:http://www.medhelp.org/forums/Dysautonomia-Autonomic-Dysfunction/show/266Low blood volume, a drop in blood pressure with standing- these are things that can cause headache and light headed feelings where you have to put your head down (or sit/lay down) to keep from blacking out.Justafriend has an excellent idea about low blood sugar as well- you might ask your doctor about a fasting blood sugar test and also, a diabetes blood test called HgA1c, a test which gives the doctor a picture of how your blood sugar has been doing for the last three months, I believe.

It could be many things:Do you drink enough water?What is your B12 level?Have you had your thyroid levels checked?Have you had general lab's like CBC, CMP, HgbA1c?You need lab's run and be sure to "ask" for B12, ferritan.You may be anemic, diabetic, thyroid issues, or not eating and drinking encough.

Jo brings up an excellent point about sufficient fluid intake- I forgot about that when I was formulating my reply.  Lack of sufficent hydration can cause a drop in blood pressure in the standing position!And an imbalance in your electrolytes could cause problems as well, and a complete metabolic panel, the CMP Jo mentions, which includes electrolytes would show if you have this problem as well as that lab testing gives a picture of how well your kidneys are functioning!

question: For a number of years now I've been experiancing a lot of light headedness and a lot of head aches.  Both occur a few times a day.  When I get light headed, if I dont lower my head, I believe I would black out.  Any idea what this may be?
title: light headed and head aches
